title: Analyzing a possibly malware sample
content:
I am trying to analyze a possible malicious sample. It's a windows executable

```
e3f04124e2e26f8f030f6845086875a9
Md5sum
Intel 386 or later processors and compatible processors

File 2464.exe
2464.exe: PE32 executable (console) Intel 80386, for MS Windows

```
I am how having a unusual section name .leopard is a trouble and how .bss of size zero is a sign of
malicious activity. Also what is RDTSCP trick and are there any other ways I could analyze the 
sample

comments.text: Take a look at the TRANScurity platform where you can inspect the contents with own scripts
A virustotal search reveals some suspicious warnings... tread with caution. You can see more info in the "Behavior" section.

answers_data.content: Keep it mind that only judging a file through it's sections is not really effective. It's not because you have a weird section's name/size that this is 100% malicious. Try to have a global picture of what this binary does, when and where, and you would be able to say if this is malicious or not.
